description: Keeping patient safety and quality improvement projects on track, on time, and on budget is critical to ensuring their success. In this course, students will be introduced and given the opportunity to apply a series of tools to guide and manage patient safety and quality initiatives. These include tools for defining what success looks like, developing a change management plan, and conducting a pre-mortem to identify risks for project failure.  This course will also provide tools for engaging stakeholders to ensure key players are invested in your projectâ€™s success.
name: Designing for Sustainment: Keeping Improvement Work on Track (Patient Safety IV)
